Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The analysis of labor problems and issues in a dynamic contemporary economy through the interaction of the four major institutions: households, firms, government, and unions.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of environmental problems from an economic perspective, its relationship to other disciplines, and the international dimension of environmental policy. Not open to Economics majors.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applies economic theory, principles, and techniques to business decision making. Students improve critical thinking skills and learn analytical tools needed to address key business issues.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of the market for health and the derived market for health care using intermediate micro-economic modeling.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the performance of industries representative of various types of market structure and practices, as well as the public policies affecting these industries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Microeconomics is used to evaluate and analyze the business and practice of sports including the structure and conduct of sports leagues, revenue sharing and other forms of cooperation, labor markets and compensation for professional athletes, public financing of sport facilities, and sports in the not-for-profit sector.

ECP3004 - Seminar on Current Economic To.name: ECP3004 - Seminar on Current Economic Topics

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Content may include, but is not limited to, the analysis of current economic issues and policy, and the study of current economic methods and theories.

ECP4303 - Environmental and Natural Reso.name: ECP4303 - Environmental and Natural Resource Economics

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provide fundamental insights into the interdependence between energy use, environmental quality, and the economy at both the microeconomic and macroeconomic level.
